intro: Spergula marginata var. reverchonii, commonly known as the narrowleaf mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial herb native to parts of Europe and Asia. It typically features small, rounded leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive silvery appearance. The plant produces tiny, white to pale blue flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom in early summer. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable species for ecological studies and habitat restoration projects.
